channel.title: Music
channel.description: NPR Music features, streams, live concerts and music news.

item.title: The Unannounced Symphony
item.description: Fridays are funnier with a classical cartoon at noon, from Deceptive Cadence.
item.content:encoded:
Fridays are funnier with a classical cartoon at noon, from Deceptive Cadence.

item.title: Ducktails: NPR Front Row
item.description: This is a live band that thrives on experimentation, playing around and taking chances. Watch Ducktails on stage at Austin's Clive Bar as the band performs "Letter of Intent," featuring kicky guitars and emotive strains of organ and synth.
item.content:encoded:
This is a live band that thrives on experimentation, playing around and taking chances. Watch Ducktails on stage at Austin's Clive Bar as the band performs "Letter of Intent," featuring kicky guitars and emotive strains of organ and synth.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Timberlake On 'N Sync, Acting And Bringing Sexy Back
item.description: Justin Timberlake rocketed to stardom as a teen heartthrob in the band 'N Sync. He has gone on to be a successful solo artist — and expanded his career into both comedic and dramatic roles on-screen. He discusses his long career in showbiz, his SNL digital shorts and his transition to film.
item.content:encoded:
Justin Timberlake rocketed to stardom as a teen heartthrob in the band 'N Sync. He has gone on to be a successful solo artist — and expanded his career into both comedic and dramatic roles on-screen. He discusses his long career in showbiz, his SNL digital shorts and his transition to film.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Mosh Pit Math: Physicists Analyze Rowdy Crowd
item.description: At a heavy metal concert five years ago, physicist Jesse Silverberg had a "eureka" moment: The jumping, raucous fans at the show seemed to be moving about like molecules in the air we breathe. So he and friend Matt Bierbaum set out to understand the patterns within mosh pit motion.
item.content:encoded:
At a heavy metal concert five years ago, physicist Jesse Silverberg had a "eureka" moment: The jumping, raucous fans at the show seemed to be moving about like molecules in the air we breathe. So he and friend Matt Bierbaum set out to understand the patterns within mosh pit motion.

item.title: Remembering Risë Stevens, A Star Of Opera And Pop Culture
item.description: The mezzo-soprano with the smoky, sultry voice defined Carmen for generations — and earned Hollywood fame at the prime of her career. Stevens died Wednesday at 99.
item.content:encoded:
The mezzo-soprano with the smoky, sultry voice defined Carmen for generations — and earned Hollywood fame at the prime of her career. Stevens died Wednesday at 99.

item.title: Vive Latino 2013: Who Rocked The House?
item.description: Once a year in Mexico City, hundreds of thousands of Latin-rock fans gather for the Vive Latino Festival, where you can hear legends and discover newcomers. Alt.Latino co-host Jasmine Garsd just got back from the three-day extravaganza, and shares some highlights.
item.content:encoded:
Once a year in Mexico City, hundreds of thousands of Latin-rock fans gather for the Vive Latino Festival, where you can hear legends and discover newcomers. Alt.Latino co-host Jasmine Garsd just got back from the three-day extravaganza, and shares some highlights.

item.title: Brooke Waggoner On Mountain Stage
item.description: Blending pop, Broadway influences and classical music, the powerful pianist plays songs from her most recent album, Originator.
item.content:encoded:
Blending pop, Broadway influences and classical music, the powerful pianist plays songs from her most recent album, Originator.

item.title: Baba Salah: A Malian Musician Speaks To His Nation's Displaced
item.description: The guitarist comes from the northern city of Gao, which has made headlines lately due to fighting by Islamist militants and French-backed Malian forces. Salah now plays at a club in Mali's capital, Bamako, where, he says, people gather to relax, reminisce and "see images other than war."
item.content:encoded:
The guitarist comes from the northern city of Gao, which has made headlines lately due to fighting by Islamist militants and French-backed Malian forces. Salah now plays at a club in Mali's capital, Bamako, where, he says, people gather to relax, reminisce and "see images other than war."

item.title: Chris Lightcap's 'Lost And Found New York' On JazzSet
item.description: From Little Italy in the Bronx to the Village Vanguard in Greenwich Village to the gardens in Fort Tryon Park, the rhythm of the city drives a suite by Chris Lightcap and his band Bigmouth. Here, they perform at the Kuumbwa Jazz Center in Santa Cruz, Calif.
item.content:encoded:
From Little Italy in the Bronx to the Village Vanguard in Greenwich Village to the gardens in Fort Tryon Park, the rhythm of the city drives a suite by Chris Lightcap and his band Bigmouth. Here, they perform at the Kuumbwa Jazz Center in Santa Cruz, Calif.

item.description: Josh Norek from the radio show The Latin Alternative discusses a subgenre of Latin electronic music.

item.title: Toro Y Moi On World Cafe
item.description: The electro-pop musician plays songs from Anything in Return and discusses his lyrical inspiration.

item.title: Chvrches: NPR Front Row
item.description: Chvrches' bass-heavy pop sounds will be the soundtrack to many a barbecue this summer, but in the meantime, the Glaswegian trio got the crowd dancing at SXSW 2013. Watch the trio perform "The Mother We Share" at Austin's Red 7.
item.content:encoded:
Chvrches' bass-heavy pop sounds will be the soundtrack to many a barbecue this summer, but in the meantime, the Glaswegian trio got the crowd dancing at SXSW 2013. Watch the trio perform "The Mother We Share" at Austin's Red 7.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: John Lennon's Bloodied Glasses Used In Plea On Gun Violence
item.description: Yoko Ono, the widow of the Beatle slain in 1980, tweets the graphic photo on the 44th anniversary of the couple's marriage.
item.content:encoded:
Yoko Ono, the widow of the Beatle slain in 1980, tweets the graphic photo on the 44th anniversary of the couple's marriage.

item.title: Sinkane: NPR Front Row
item.description: The day before Sinkane joined Usher and The Afghan Whigs on stage at SXSW, he played a smaller, Filter magazine-sponsored show at Austin's Clive Bar. Luckily, our video crew was there to capture this live performance of "Jeeper Creeper."
item.content:encoded:
The day before Sinkane joined Usher and The Afghan Whigs on stage at SXSW, he played a smaller, Filter magazine-sponsored show at Austin's Clive Bar. Luckily, our video crew was there to capture this live performance of "Jeeper Creeper."

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Song Premiere: John Grant, 'It Doesn't Matter To Him'
item.description: Like many of the songs on John Grant's new album, Pale Green Ghosts, "It Doesn't Matter To Him" mixes self-effacing humor with real-life heartbreak, to the sounds of acoustic guitar and snow-blown synths.
item.content:encoded:
Like many of the songs on John Grant's new album, Pale Green Ghosts, "It Doesn't Matter To Him" mixes self-effacing humor with real-life heartbreak, to the sounds of acoustic guitar and snow-blown synths.
